@ijuma @gwenshap I've updated the script to address the concerns mentioned:

* Preferences get loaded/saved to a file once you've entered them all and you'll see them printed with the initial prompt.
* Fix cleanup. I had this partly in place but forgot to enable it for most paths because having it off was useful during debugging. It's not perfect, but captures most cases.
* Get rid of references to trunk, just store the branch the user is on when they start
* Use 2.12 instead of more specific versions.

@eno we could do a test run, just with `max.inflight.transaction=1` -- but we know from producer test that there is a 20% hit. Do you think we can gain any insight for running Streams test with this setting?

Test FAILed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.11).

I think yes -- the failure we observed is unrelated to the consumer reset strategy (cf https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/2931/files#r114402394). The prefix did always match -- the test failed because different number of records got returned and thus the lists did not match because of different size.

@sriramsub Do you mean "cleanRun" ? This affects only test code atm. We can also fix it right away in this PR.

I meant all the different code path with the eosEnabled checks makes it hard to understand code, hard to maintain and will not be easy to debug. It would be good to think about code restructuring after this release to make this better.
